Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 782 Filed 01/15/25 Page 26 of 158 26
LBAGmax2
Rocchio - Direct

1 BY MS. POMERANTZ:
2 Q. What is the division of trauma psychology?
3 A. So the national organization for -- professional organization for psychology, within that organization, there
4 are 56 separate divisions that each focus on a distinct area, specialized area of psychology. And I belong to a number of
5 those divisions of psychology.
6 Q. Have you served in a leadership position with other professional organizations?
7 A. Yes, I have.
8 Q. Can you briefly describe?
9 A. I served on the Rhode Island psychological association. I've served on the committee for state leaders, which is an
10 organization within the American psychological association dealing with various states and advocacy for issues related to
11 psychology.
12 Q. How do you keep up to date on the subjects in which you specialize?
13 A. In a variety of ways. Certainly, I regularly review the scientific and legal literature. I attend programming. I
14 consult with peers in my field. I attend trainings. And then of course, I bring that information back to my experience, both
15 in clinical and forensic settings, and learn from my patients and the people that I evaluate in my experience.
16 Q. In what areas have you received additional education and

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300

DOJ-OGR-00014902
